latest.title: Transaction in Own Shares
latest.content:
23 Jan 2026 07:00
RNS Number : 0480Q
dotDigital Group plc
23 January 2026
23 January 2026
Dotdigital Group plc
("Dotdigital" or the "Group")
Transaction in Own Shares
Dotdigital Group plc
(AIM: DOTD), the leading SaaS provider of an all-in-one customer experience and data platform (CXDP), announces that it has made the following purchases of ordinary shares of 0.5 pence each in the capital of the Group ("Ordinary Shares") from Canaccord Genuity Limited on the London Stock Exchange pursuant to the Share Buyback Programme announced on 10 December 2025.
Date of purchase
22 January 2026
Number of Ordinary Shares purchased (aggregated volume):
72,000
Highest Price paid per Ordinary Share (p):
67.00
Lowest Price paid per Ordinary Share (p):
67.00
Volume Weighted Average Price paid per Ordinary Share (p):
67.00
Venue where Ordinary Shares are traded
London Stock Exchange (AIMX)
The Group will hold the repurchased shares in treasury. Following the purchase, the number of Ordinary Shares in issue and admitted to trading on AIM will be 303,662,946 (excluding treasury shares), and the Group will hold 4,794,000 ordinary shares in treasury.
This figure of 303,662,946 Ordinary Shares may be used by shareholders in the Group as the denominator for the calculations by which they will determine if they are required to notify their interest in, or a change of their interest in, the share capital of the Group under the Financial Conduct Authority's Disclosure Guidance and Transparency Rules.
The Group will make further announcements in due course following the completion of any further purchases pursuant to the Share Buyback Programme.
In accordance with Article 5(1)(b) of Regulation (EU) No 596/2014 (the Market Abuse Regulation), the schedule below contains detailed information about the purchases made by Canaccord Genuity Limited on behalf of the Group.

About Dotdigital
Dotdigital Group plc (AIM: DOTD) is a leading provider of cross-channel marketing automation technology to marketing professionals. Dotdigital's customer experience and data platform (CXDP) combines the power of automation and AI to help businesses deliver hyper-relevant customer experiences at scale. With Dotdigital, marketing teams can unify and enrich their customer data, identify valuable customer segments, and deliver personalised cross-channel customer journeys that result in engagements, conversions, and loyalty.
Founded in 1999, Dotdigital is headquartered in London with offices in Manchester, Southampton, New York, Melbourne, Sydney, Singapore, Tokyo and Cape Town. Dotdigital's solutions empower over 4,000 brands across 150 countries.
This information is provided by RNS, the news service of the London Stock Exchange. RNS is approved by the Financial Conduct Authority to act as a Primary Information Provider in the United Kingdom. ai_insights.narrative_summary: DOTD.L presents a standard crash recovery setup without unusual patterns detected. Monitor for catalyst developments and trend shifts.

panic_analysis.opportunity_reason: 📊 Moderate fear detected - monitor for escalation

fear_vs_facts.verdict: ⚖️ Mixed signals - Fear and facts balanced, wait for clarity

catalyst_pipeline.title: Watch for: Funding announcement or operational update

decision_matrix.reason: ⏳ Monitor for timing regime change or panic escalation

volume_death.description: High volume - Panic spike or interest

technical_score.reason: AI Technical Score 15.0/20 translates to 19/25 points

reasons_to_buy.reason: Early stage positioning offers best R:R if catalysts appear
Proven winner - previously hit lock-in target

reasons_to_sell.reason: Stale signal - not for active trading

trader_plan.action: Wait for base + catalyst confirmation; starter position only
trader_plan.risk: Invalidation = breaks recent lows / dilution / suspension
trader_plan.profit_taking: Scale out 25% at +15%, 25% at +50%, runner above

investor_plan.thesis_conditions: Unlock after AI triangulation + CONFIRMED timing

commentary.executive_summary: Note: this report used historical signals only — live triangulation (RNS, social, Trends) was not available. Current setup looks like EARLY_BUILD with an APEX score of 58/100. Historically there have been 1 rallies (avg. 90%); the position is now +17.3%. Practical take: this is interesting but unconfirmed — wait for an AI snapshot or clear confirmation before committing size.
bull_case: Early accumulation — good risk/reward if it confirms
bear_case: No immediate red flags, but keep stops tight
commentary.timing_translation: Accumulation in progress. Consider small starters but wait for confirmation before sizing up.
commentary.confidence_explained: Confidence 40/100 — data triangulated from RNS, social and Trends.

data_quality.disclaimer: Data provided as-is. Not financial advice. AIM micro-caps carry significant volatility risk.
